result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Irwin Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $150.00 plus costs. To be paid by 3/7/2016 or civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Irwin Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court orders Defendant to pay a fine of $150.00 plus costs to be paid by 03-07-2016 or Civil Judgment.

Defendant Todd Irwin Smith in court with attorney Robert J. LaBelle.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Todd Irwin Smith in court with Attorney Robert J. LaBelle.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.
Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 38.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated November 13, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Filed by Defense: Demand for Specific Kyles and Brady Information and Motion to Suppress Statement
Statement by Audrey L. regarding the no contact order. Arguments heard.  Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Todd Irwin Smith in court with attorney Robert J. LaBelle.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Any motions are due within 30 days from today. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.

15RM035290  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/15/2015
Court ordered defendant to have no contact with victim, Audrey Lee, except at work, then no violent contact.  mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No posssession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  No firearms / dangerous weapons.   mld

Defendant Todd Irwin Smith in court with Attorney Joseph Kennedy for Attorney Robert J. LaBelle.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statement made by victim, Audrey L.  

Defense Motion to Modify the No Contact Order was heard and granted by the Court.  The Court ordered Justice Point Supervision as a Condition of Bail.  

Court ordered that the parties may have no violent contact at work ONLY.  All other conditions of the no contact order are continued.     

Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-18-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld
to Modify Bail from defense, received and filed.   mld
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.L. (DOB 7/25/85).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Todd Irwin Smith in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-137
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Bail Bond Hearing in Branch 04.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-17-2015 at 01:30pm
